title: consumergrade
extract: For me, “consumer-grade UX” means that the quality of the software is so high that a consumer would pay with his or her own money to own and use the software for their private use, á la TurboTax. I say “pay” because we generally define a consumer as someone who buys something.
extract_html: For me, “consumer-grade UX” means that the quality of the software is so high that a consumer would pay with his or her own money to own and use the software for their private use, á la TurboTax. I say “pay” because we generally define a consumer as someone who buys something.
